title: Complete initSession ok response from server to client
description:
Encapsulates a device-to-client message sent via the signaling server.
This flavour of the signaling message defines the format that the server uses when forwarding a message sent from the device to the client.
Consequently it defines the format that a client must understand when receiving.

type.description: Specifies this message as a signaling message.

targetId.description: The target id from which the message is sent.

orgId.description: The id of the organization that the device belongs to.

P2P.title: initSession successful response
P2P.description: This message is sent from device to client to indicate that the device has successfully validated the client request.

apiVersion.description:
The API version actually used by the device.
Note that this schema documents a specific version which makes this property a constant here.
A client should be prepared to receive a response with a different minor version in which case the response is fully defined by the schema corresponding to that minor version.

type.description: Specifies that this message is a response

sessionId.description: An identifier chosen by the client that should be used for all messages belonging to this session.

context.description: Echoes back the corresponding data that the client sent in its request.

id.description: A string chosen by the device that may be used for debugging purposes.

data.description: The presence of a data object indicates a successful validation
